page.title: 04LYME LANDSLIP - APPEARANCE
page.content: The physical appearance is determined by the instability of the rocks.When it rains the water soaks into the soil passing through the porous rock until it reaches an anticline in a layer of impervious rock (rock which does not allow air, water, gas, oil etc to pass through it). When the water reaches the impervious rock it then flows along the clay terraces. The cliff terraces are breaks or cracks in the land caused by land slips. The terraces start below the golf course at 400ft and stretch over several hundred yards down to sea level. The lower land is a grey colour while the higher land is an orange colour, sandstone. In a storm the central area of Black Ven is a huge mud glacier while the Western half remains almost unaffected and retains its original profile.
